content:
You're welcome! I'm glad you found the tips helpful. The hanger trick is a simple yet effective way to identify items that might be collecting dust in your closet. And storing out-of-season clothes in bins or containers can really help declutter your space.

Getting stackable shelves for your closet is a great idea, too. It'll help you maximize your vertical space and keep your clothes organized.

Now, about that bright yellow sundress... It's great that you're thinking ahead and wanting to check in with your sister about it. Lending clothes to friends and family can be a bit risky, but it's always nice to share and help each other out.

Here's a suggestion: why not send your sister a quick text or make a mental note to ask her about the dress when you next talk to her? You could say something like, "Hey, how was the party? And by the way, how's my yellow sundress doing? Did everything go okay with it?"

By checking in, you'll not only ensure that your dress is safe and sound but also show your sister that you care about your belongings and appreciate her consideration.

Do you have any other items that you've lent out to friends or family that you're keeping track of?
